section.title: Purpose
section.p: EqfImportFolderAs2 imports a folder from a specific path to the specified drive, and the folder name and the names of the Translation Memory databases can be changed during the import.
This function performs the import in small units. Call it repetitively until it returns a return code other than CONTINUE_RC.

row.entry: The EQF session handle, as returned by EqfStartSession.
The name of the folder to be imported.
The path from which the folder is imported from.
The target drive for the imported folder. If omitted, the primary OTM drive is used. The drive must be the primary OTM drive or one of the secondary OTM drives defined in the Configure Drives window.
The new name of the folder.

A list of new Translation Memory names for the Translation Memory databases contained in the folder , the names are specified in a comma separated list, the first entry is the new name for the folder Translation Memory, the remaining names are the new names for the search Translation Memory databases. Entries in the list can be left empty when a specific memory should not be renamed.

The options to be used for the export:
WITHMEM_OPT WITHDICT_OPT XLIFF_OPT
These options correspond to those in the Import Folder window in OpenTM2.
You can combine the constants using OR.
The folder import has not completed yet. Call EqfImportFolderFP again.

entry.ph: Error code (EQF message number). Use EqfGetLastError (see page ) to retrieve the complete error information.
Error code (EQF message number). Use to retrieve the complete error information.
